Package assignment

Class ImageEffect

java.lang.Object
assignment.ImageEffect
Direct Known Subclasses:
BlackAndWhite, BlueOnly, ColorShift, DeNoise, DeNoiseBrightness, Dilate, Erode, GreenOnly, Grow, HighlightEdges, HorizontalReflect, Invert, NoBlue, NoGreen, NoRed, RedOnly, Sharpen, Shrink, Smooth, Threshold, VerticalReflect
public abstract class ImageEffect extends Object
Abstract superclass for classes implementing single-source/single-destination transformations of 24-bit RGB images.

This class is primarily concerned with manipulating images stored as two-dimensional arrays of pixel information, i.e. int[][] pixels. Such arrays conform to the following specifications:

  • Pixel information is stored in row-column order, thus the first array index specifies a row in an image and the second array index specifies a column in an image. The upper-left pixel of an image is row 0, column 0.
  • The width of an image (number of columns) is the length of the second array dimension, e.g. pixels[0].length, and the height of an image (number of rows) is the length of the first array dimension, e.g. pixels.length.
  • Each pixel is a 24-bit RGB value packed in a 32-bit int. The red, blue, and green components of a pixel may be retrieved via the convenience methods getRed, getGreen, and getBlue. The packed int representation for a pixel with specific red, blue, and green components may be constructed via the convenience method makePixel.

      Returns:

      Returns:
      a BufferedImage representing the source image.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the source image is ill-defined.
